selectedVerses.text: And the LORD of hosts will wield against them a whip, as when he struck Midian at the rock of Oreb. And his staff will be over the sea, and he will lift it as he did in Egypt.
Shall the axe boast over him who hews with it, or the saw magnify itself against him who wields it? As if a rod should wield him who lifts it, or as if a staff should lift him who is not wood!
And there you shall build an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones. You shall wield no iron tool on them;
For I have bent Judah as my bow; I have made Ephraim its arrow. I will stir up your sons, O Zion, against your sons, O Greece, and wield you like a warrior's sword.
If you make me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of hewn stones, for if you wield your tool on it you profane it.
